name: European Junior Doctors Association
membership: European Medical Organisations (EMO) â€“ Presidents Committee
goal: Representing over 300.000 Junior Doctors all over Europe the EJD's initial objective includes safeguarding the interests of the Junior Doctors in Europe by improving the working conditions, the mobility in the profession and set standards regarding the quality of postgraduate medical training.
interests: Climate Action, Consumers, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Youth
euInitiatives:
Revision of the Professional Qualification Directive, Directive 2005/36/EC

Revision of the Working Time Directive (2003/88/EC)

eHealth Action Plan and further initiatives and projects

Joint Action on Health Workforce Planning and Forecasting
